authors: Brianne Tolj For Daily Mail Australia
description: A 'severely malnourished' four-year-old girl is still in hospital receiving treatment almost one month after police removed her from a south New South Wales home and her caregivers.
title: Nowra girl in NSW hospital a month after being found with severe malnutrition
title_page: Nowra girl in NSW hospital a month after being found with severe malnutrition | Daily Mail Online
text:
A severely malnourished four-year-old girl is still in hospital receiving treatment almost one month after police removed her from her home on the New South Wales south coast.
Her carers, a 25-year-old woman and a 34-year-old man, were arrested and charged on December 31 in Nowra, on the New South Wales south coast, with failure to provide for a child causing danger of death, according to police.
Officers were told about the little girl on December 12 when a member of the community called and said they were concerned.
The girl remains in hospital being treated almost a month after she was removed from the home and her one-year-old sister was also removed (stock photo)
When they arrived at the Nowra home that day, police saw the girl was in an alleged emaciated condition.
The child was taken to a hospital for treatment and her one-year-old sister was also removed from the home and the man and woman’s care.
The man and woman were released on bail with conditions and will appear in court on January 18.
The State Crime Command’s Child Abuse Squad is investigating and urges anyone who is worried about a child and the condition they live in to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
The man and woman were released on conditional bail and will appear at the Nowra Local Court (pictured) on January 18
